entry.title: Formatted Search - InStock - Committed with decimal point
entry.content:
Hi,
I am trying to pull the onhand - committed for an item, I added a UDF and made it Numeric

This is my formatted search

SELECT ROUND(ISNULL(T0."OnHand", 0) - ISNULL(T0."IsCommited", 0), 2)
FROM OITW T0
WHERE T0."ItemCode" = $[$5.0.0] AND T0."WhsCode" = '01

It works fine if there is no decimal in point in the Onhand or Committed, but gives me an error if there is a decimal.

Can someone give me some guidance to me?

entry.title: Bank statement processing- not all processed lines created payments or journal entries
entry.content:
Hi All,
Something strange happened when processing a bank statment via the Bank Statement Processing window. 
On the 29/07/2025 a bank statement with 222 lines were processed, but only 48 lines  actually were created as outgoing payments. The file was finalized and did not give any errors when processing. 


When clicking on the first journal entry drill down, it opens a blank Journal Entry

We do process multiple bank statements on daily basis, and it seems to be an isolated issue. Not sure what could of caused it and where to view log files to find any info regarding this issue. 
We are on version 10 for HANA, FP2208. 

Thanks all,
Jerusha

entry.title: Supplier payment flow file - SAP B1 Localisation UK
entry.content:
Hi all,

we need to be able to generate payment flows to banks from SAP B1 in the UK. We have noticed that there are already some formats that could be used in the payment methods :

SAPBPUKOPBT_BACS

SAPBPUKOPBT_BACS_TELEBANK

SAPBPUKOPBT_BACS_BARCLAY

 

but these formats are not associated with any structure and we have not been able to find it on the SAP portal to download it.

We asked our SAP BO Italian partner and this was their response:

‚ÄúThis template does not exist.

The bank file for SAPBPUKOPBT_BACS is actually an application (plugin .dll), which is only installed when the Payment Engine is installed.

The format is program-encoded and cannot be modified by the user.

It can be found in C:\Program Files\SAP\SAP Business One\AddOns\sap\Payment‚Äù

We have therefore installed and connected the payment add-on, but we are still encountering errors during execution. Below are some example screenshots.

Does anyone have any suggestions? 

Thank you very much.

 

Kind regards,

Barbara Camus

Add-on payment connected :

Payment Method linked to SAPBPUKOPBT_BACS :

Error while creating file :

entry.title: SAP B1 10.0 FP 2411 ‚Äì OBTF / Journal Voucher: ONNM.AutoKey (ObjectCode 28) does not increment
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

in SAP Business One 10.0 FP 2411 - MS SQL,  when adding a Journal Voucher (table OBTF), the AutoKey in ONNM for ObjectCode = 28 does not increment by +1 upon completing the operation. As a result, the next insertion attempt reuses the same BatchNum, causing the following error:
‚ÄúThis entry already exists in the following tables ‚ÄòDocument with provisional postings‚Äô (OBTF) (ODBC-2035) [Message 131-183]‚Äù.
The issue is temporarily resolved by manually aligning ONNM.AutoKey or restoring document numbering, but it reoccurs afterwards. 
Can you help  me? 
Thanks in advance. 

Best Regards

entry.title: DI API Problem Class COM with SAP Business One Application
entry.content:
Hello !

I share with you the solution found for a problem that i had while creating an application that communiquates with SAP Business One.

The problem (error) was :

While creating a solution for a client, requiring a connection to the SAP system, we encountered the following issue:The app is generated in 64-bit, but if SAP DIAPI 32 is installed, it points to it, resulting in a COM class error. If DIAPI 32 is not installed, the application points to 64 and works normally!
üîπ The application is correctly compiled in 64-bit.
üîπ We want to install the 32-bit DI API (in addition to the 64-bit), which is necessary for launching certain add-ons. However, when it is installed, the app crashes because it automatically connects to the 32-bit DI API instead of the 64-bit one.
üëâ Result: COM error (Class not registered, Retrieving the COM class factory failed, etc.) when both versions are installed, even though the app is 64-bit.

 

Please find the solution in the following post : https://www.linkedin.com/posts/tarik-bentayeb-5a81501bb_solution-pour-un-probl%C3%A8me-di-api-sap-b1-activity-7360321854651125760-WAqv?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAADMZ1FAB2YZRL7QaWU7ODUDS4cddMYfS2HE

 

SAP Business One

entry.title: Second server for db Sap Business One 10
entry.content:
Good morning.
To improve the performance of the databases I currently have on an SQL server, I need to install a second server and would like to know if it's possible to use the licenses on the first one. The users are the same, but they must log in to one server or the other, depending on the company they want to consult. In the installation of SAP Business One components, I noticed a step that asks if the license server is new or already exists. Is it in this step that I can direct the second server to the first one, which is where the license manager is located?
I would appreciate any guidance and if there is a manual for configuring it.

Best regards,

Marco.

entry.title: Issue with a simple FMS
entry.content:
Hi All,

I've created a udf: Tariff (Type Percents) and i want the fms to calculate Unitprice*U_Tariff/100.

FMS created: 

SELECT  $[RDR1.PriceBefDi.NUMBER] * $[RDR1.U_Tariff.NUMBER]/100

I want this to calculated in a udf as soon as Tariff% is calculated but i get the below error:

1). [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Incorrect syntax near '15.000000'.  --> (15 entered in Tariff UDF)
2). [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Statement 'Shipping Types' (OSHP) (s) could not be prepared.--> Not sure where this is coming from..

Can someone please point out what's wrong with the fms and how to fix this?

Regards,

Joseph

entry.title: List Item Not Repeating Data in SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm trying to create a simple list view to display the item's warehouse availability, similar to how SAP B1 does in the Stock tab of Item Master Data.

In there, basic fields such as warehouse code, in stock, committed, and ordered. The input comes from a scanned barcode, which in turn is associated with the Item Master. Fetching header-level data is fine. I managed to get Item Code, Item Name, and I could get any other data from the same level. But when it comes to nested data, in this case, warehouse data related to the item, I got stuck. I describe how I set up the data source and how I am managing data/page variables:

Data Source

In this system, we are using SAP Cloud Connector to link BTP to our On-Premise landscape. We created a destination called SBOSL, which points to the Service Layer root endpoint, whereby all exposed entities can be used. SBOSL then gets available as data source in SAP Build Apps, and all I had to do was enabling the entities I wanted to work with. In this case, Items. It seems to be a rather straightforward manner to source data, as we have no need to create and manage API calls by setting up headers, body, parameter, etc. Everything is handled through the UI.

Data Variables

I have set a data variable called itemByBarcode, from the type "Collection of data records". Here, I configured a filter condition (where Barcode = scannedBarcode), and the fields as List of Values (ItemCode, ItemName, BarCode, ItemWarehouseInfoCollection).

Logic

The current logic consists on:

  1. Scan Barcode
  2. Store the scanned barcode in the page variable scannedBarcode
  3. Get Record Collection by using scannedBarcode variable
  4. Bind a data variable node to the itemByBarcode data variable

List Item

We added a list item called Warehouse List, and bind the "Repeat With" property to the formula data.itemByBarcode[0].ItemWarehouseInfoCollection. Inside of the list item, we placed a row with 4 cells, and each cell includes a text element where the warehouse data goes in (warehouse code, in stock, committed, ordered). The tree points to Row > Cell > Text, so there is no container aggregating the elements, which could potentially block the data flow.

The problem is that, even setting up the repeater in the outer list, I cannot see the individual fields to bind to each warehouse field, such as warehouse code, in stock, and so on. I tried to hardcode it via formula (e.g. current.WhsCode), but it doesn't work, as expected.

Also tried to bind via Data Item to repeat, and the nested data (Item > ItemWarehouseInfoCollection) doesn't appear to be available.

Outcomes

When previewing the App, at least I can see that the quantity of lines printed matches SAP. I even added a text to debug how many records are being fetch (quantity of warehouses), and it also matches (5), but the data itself still doesn't show up in the list.

Any comments or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in anticipation!

BR,
Felipe

entry.title: Why Does SAP B1 Allow Backdated Delivery Without Inventory? (Moving Average + Negative Stock Issue)
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

My colleague encountered a confusing behavior in SAP Business One 10.0 FP 2402 HF01 (SQL version) related to backdated deliveries and inventory logic. We'd like to ask for your insights.

LocalizationÔºöChina

Scenario:

  • In a test database, we used a brand-new item that had zero inventory.

  • On 2025/08/15, we posted a Goods Receipt of 1,000 units, unit cost = 1.00 (Posting Date = 2025/08/15).

  • Then we created two Delivery documents with Posting Dates set as:

    • 2025/08/01 (Delivered 1 unit)

    • 2025/08/10 (Delivered 1 unit)

To our surprise, both deliveries were posted successfully, even though the item had no inventory on those posting dates (08/01 & 08/10).

Accounting Observations:

  • The Inventory Audit Report, when filtered between 2025/08/01 ~ 2025/08/10, shows the item‚Äôs stock as -2.

  • The G/L report, for the same date range, shows a negative balance for the inventory account.

System Configuration:

Company-Level Settings:

  • ‚úÖ Perpetual Inventory: Enabled

  • ‚úÖ Item Valuation Method: Moving Average

  • ‚úÖ ‚ÄúAllow stock release without item cost‚Äù: Checked

Document Settings (Administration ‚Üí System Initialization ‚Üí Document Settings):

  • ‚úÖ Block Negative Inventory By: Warehouse

 

Questions:

  1. Why does the system allow delivery posting with backdated posting dates, even when no inventory existed on those dates?

  2. In this case, how is the Moving Average cost calculated and adjusted after the receipt is posted later?

  3. Are there any best practices or system controls to prevent this kind of unexpected delivery posting?

I‚Äôve attached screenshots of the Inventory Audit Report and system configuration for reference.
Looking forward to your advice and insights‚Äîthanks in advance!

entry.content:
Hello experts,

I have problem like in outgoing payment screen for vendor and when i pay vendor for the invoice and deducts bank charges,The journal entry does not seem correct. Can anyone explain how to pay bank charges on two conditions: when company bears it and when vendor bears it.
